DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response for questions capturing the "Z" or third measurement (diameter or size) or location in millimeters.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard. Following the second position in an ordering or series; coming next after the second and just before the fourth in position. The magnitude of something in a particular direction, especially length or width or height.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Measurement is the determination of the size or magnitude of something.  It is also used ro refer to the result of this act.

Concepts.definition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

Property.preferredDefinition: Following the second position in an ordering or series.:Dimension; the magnitude of something in a particular direction, especially length or width or height.

Concepts.definition: Following the second position in an ordering or series; coming next after the second and just before the fourth in position.
The magnitude of something in a particular direction, especially length or width or height.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter) or approximately 0.03937 inch._A number that can have its decimal point in any position.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
